q: Donald Rumsfeld arrives bang on time and greets me with a disconcertingly warm smile. He is dressed formally in a gray suit, pale blue shirt and striped tie. He sits down and swiftly asks me a question: Have you read the book? What was your reaction? I say that I have read most of the book on the flight over from London and that I had enjoyed it-particularly the early chapters about his life growing up in suburban Chicago and his memories of selling

The three didn't always agree, particularly when it came to coping with rules in China that require Web-search providers to censor results that government officials deem inappropriate.
